snippet: In his first televised policy speech since taking office, Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif also maintained the option of military action against militants.
abstract: Pakistani Prime Min Nawaz Sharif hints at his government's inclination to hold talks with Taliban militants in his first televised policy speech to the country since assuming office, even while maintaining the option of military action against them.
lead_paragraph: In his first televised policy speech since taking office, Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif also maintained the option of military action against militants.

headline.main: Prime Minister of Pakistan Open to Talks With Taliban
headline.print_headline: Prime Minister Of Pakistan Open to Talks With Taliban
